noun.description: A hard tough thermoplastic substance which is the coagulated latex of certain Malaysian trees. It consists chiefly of a hydrocarbon isomeric with rubber and is now used chiefly in dentistry and for electrical insulation.

origin: Mid 19th century: from Malay getah perca, from getah gum + perca strips of cloth (which it resembles), altered by association with obsolete gutta gum, from Latin gutta a drop.
